document.masterDocTitle: Deep-sea Rhachotropis (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Eusiridae) from New Zealand and the Ross Sea with key to the Pacific, Indian Ocean and Antarctic species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Deep-sea Rhachotropis (Crustacea: Amphipoda: Eusiridae) from New Zealand and the Ross Sea with key to the Pacific, Indian Ocean and Antarctic species

heading.emphasis:
Key to Indo-Pacific and Antarctic species of
Rhachotropis

paragraph.keyLead:
2 . Pereonites laterally smooth, coxa 1 anteroventrally rounded .....................................................................
R. glorisae

- Pereonites lateral process, coxa 1 anteroventrally pointed ....................................................
R. chathamensis
sp. nov.

- Pereonite 7 smooth or very small carinae, telson cleft about 50 % .............................................................
R. macropus

8 . Telson cleft about one third; dorsal protrusion on urosomite 1 not reaching end of urosomite 2 ............
R. antarctica

10 . Pereopods 3 and 4 dactylus long; inner margin uropod 3 setose...................................................................
R. oculata

- Pereopod 3 and 4 dactylus short; uropod 3 inner margin spinose .................................................................
R. minuta

- Pereopod 5 and 6 posterior margin of basis smooth; Antenna 1 same length than antenna 2 ............
R. schelllenbergi

14 . Telson longer than uropod 3 : gnathopods 1 and 2 propodi slender ...............................................................
R. elliotta

- Telson shorter than uropod 3 : gnathopods 1 and 2 propodi rounded .........................................................
R. conlanae

19 . Epimeral plates laterally smooth; no calceoli on antenna...............................................................................
R. ludifer

- Epimeral plates with lateral process; calceoli on antenna 1 and antenna 2 ..............................................
R. calceolate
23 . Epimeral plates 2 and 3 bearing lateral process, telson cleft to at least one-third ...................................................... 24

- Epimeral plates 2 and 3 laterally smooth, no distinct processes; telson cleft to less than one-quarter
R. rossi
sp. nov.

24 . Dorsal process of epimeral plate 2 twice as long as process from epimeral plate 1 and 3 ......................
R. multesimus

- Dorsal process of epimeral plate 2 longer than dorsal process of epimeral plate 1 and 3 ......................
R. americana
- Antenna lacking calceoli; urosomite 1 laterally smooth; uropod 1 rami subequal in length...................................... 28

- Mid-dorsal carinae of epimeron 1 and 2 simple; pereopod 7 basis with distinct tooth midposteriorly......
R. gubilata

27 . Coxa 1 expanded; pereopod 7 basis strongly notched .................................................................
R. abyssalis
sp. nov.

28 . Gnathopod 2 basis expanded; posterolateral corners of epimeral plates 1 and 2 subquadrate ......
R. delicata
sp. nov.

- Gnathopod 2 basis parallel; posterolateral corners of epimeral plates 1 and 2 broadly rounded .................
R. sibogae
